content:
There are several things individuals can do to help reduce pollution in New Delhi, including:

1. Use public transportation or carpool with others to reduce vehicular emissions.
2. Use energy-efficient appliances and light bulbs to save energy and reduce emissions.
3. Plant trees and support efforts to increase green space in the city to improve air quality.
4. Dispose of waste properly and avoid open burning of trash and crops.
5. Support organizations and campaigns working towards pollution control and environmental protection.
6. Avoid burning wood or coal for cooking or heating and switch to cleaner sources of energy.
7. Use masks to reduce exposure to polluted air particularly during days of very high AQI.
8. Support green and sustainable development and practices whenever possible.
9. Promote bike-friendly infrastructure and slow mobility options in the city.

While individual actions may seem small in comparison to the severity of the issue, every effort to reduce pollution can have a significant impact when collectively applied.
